DataElement.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Retinal Vein Occlusion Central Serous Chorioretinopathy Eligibility Determination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response indicating the patient meets the eligibility requirements for participation in a clinical trial with regards to having a history of retinal vein occlusion or central serous chorioretinopathy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Retinal Vein Occlusion Central Serous Chorioretinopathy Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._An occlusion of the retinal vein._A self-resolving eye condition characterized by fluid accumulation under the macula in the retina. It results from leakage of fluid from the choroid. It usually affects one eye only and the vast majority of patients regain full vision._The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Retinal Vein Occlusion Central Serous Chorioretinopathy Eligibility Determination
Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Occlusion of the retinal vein. Those at high risk for this condition include patients with hypertension, diabetes mellitus, arteriosclerosis, and other cardiovascular diseases.:A self-resolving eye condition characterized by fluid accumulation under the macula in the retina. It results from leakage of fluid from the choroid. It usually affects one eye only and the vast majority of patients regain full vision.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
An occlusion of the retinal vein.

A self-resolving eye condition characterized by fluid accumulation under the macula in the retina. It results from leakage of fluid from the choroid. It usually affects one eye only and the vast majority of patients regain full vision.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient having a history of retinal vein occlusion or central serous chorioretinopathy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patients have a history of RVO or CSR, or predisposing factors to RVO or CSR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of RVO or CSR, or predisposing factors to RVO or CSR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have predisposing factors to RVO or CSR?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a known significant ophthalmologic condition or known risk factors for retinal vein occlusion (RVO) or central serous retinopathy (CSR)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patients have a history of RVO or CSR, or predisposing factors to RVO or CSR (e.g., uncontrolled glaucoma or ocular hypertension, uncontrolled systemic disease(s) such as hypertension, diabetes mellitus, or a history of hyperviscosity or hypercoagulability syndromes)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have past history of retinal pigment epithelial detachment/central serous retinopathy or retinal vein occlusion?
